title: [BUG] wrong dtype inferred when parsing datelikes columns

labels.name: area/scoring
labels.description: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs

labels.name: area/docker
labels.description: Docker use anywhere, such as MLprojects and MLmodels

body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md) for additional information about bug reports. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

**Please fill in this bug report template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [x] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [ ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: 
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Linux Ubuntu 18.04
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: source
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**:  1.10.1.dev0
- **Python version**:  sys.version_info(major=3, minor=8, micro=5, releaselevel='final', serial=0
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**:
- **Exact command to reproduce**:

### Describe the problem

`mlflow.pyfunc.scoring_server.parse_json_input` not convert column dtype as input schema types if column name is conform to pandas datelike column names,  and evently raise `TypeError: Cannot interpret 'StringDtype' as a data type` in `_enforce_type` line 313. 

### Code to reproduce issue

parse input data contains datelike columns, check their
```python

import pandas as pd
import json
import 


raw_data = json.dumps({
    "columns": ["code_id", "start_time", "end_time"],
    "data": [["130302198704131813", "2020-08-01", "2020-08-05"]]
})
data = parse_json_input(raw_data, orient='split', schema=schema)

print(data)
```

this get  

```
code_id               object
start_time    datetime64[ns]
end_time      datetime64[ns]
dtype: object

```
then,  in  `_enforce_schema`  call 

```python
from mlflow.pyfunc import _enforce_schema

_enforce_schema(data, schema)

```
raise 

```ipython
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-8-56d218bd9656> in <module>
      1 from mlflow.pyfunc import _enforce_schema
      2 
----> 3 _enforce_schema(data, schema)

/opt/conda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/__init__.py in _enforce_schema(pdf, input_schema)
    383     new_pdf = pandas.DataFrame()
    384     for i, x in enumerate(col_names):
--> 385         new_pdf[x] = _enforce_type(x, pdf[x], col_types[i])
    386     return new_pdf
    387 

/opt/conda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/__init__.py in _enforce_type(name, values, t)
    311             )
    312 
--> 313     if values.dtype in (t.to_pandas(), t.to_numpy()):
    314         # The types are already compatible => conversion is not necessary.
    315         return values

TypeError: Cannot interpret 'StringDtype' as a data type
```

more seriously, datetime type not contains in mlflow `DataType` range. this will bypass lots'  datatype sanity check 

### Other info / logs
Include any logs or source code that would be helpful to diagnose the problem. If including tracebacks, please include the full traceback. Large logs and files should be attached.


### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this bug affect?
Components 
- [ ] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [ ] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [x] `area/scoring`: Local serving, model deployment tools, spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow server, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

Interface 
- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, JavaScript, plotting
- [x] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

Language 
- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages

Integrations
- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations
- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
